meta.idea: Witty detective with a dark past

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Quick-Witted Noir Detective

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Past Won't Stay Buried

stunts.name: I've Seen It All Before
stunts.description: Because your past is full of grim cases, you get a +2 to Overcome with Investigate when examining a situation that reminds you of a case you'd rather forget.

output.notes: This stunt provides a mechanical bonus directly tied to your character's Trouble aspect, 'My Past Won't Stay Buried'. This encourages bringing that aspect into play in ways that aren't just a compel, giving you an edge when confronting situations that echo your dark history.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Exiled Scion of a Magical Bloodline

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Family's Enemies Are Now Mine

stunts.name: Arcane Flourish
stunts.description: When you use Fight to Create an Advantage by weaving a minor cantrip into your swordplay, creating aspects like **Dazzling Feint** or **Entangling Shadows**, you gain an additional free invoke if you succeed with style.

output.notes: This stunt for your swordmage focuses on cinematic action, blending swordplay with magic. It enhances your ability to control the flow of a conflict by rewarding exceptional Create an Advantage actions with more narrative power, fitting the 'wandering swordmage' concept.

meta.idea: Cynical medic who can hear ghosts

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Pragmatic Medic Plagued by Spirits

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Whispers Never Stop

stunts.name: Acrobat's Flourish
stunts.description: +2 to Overcome with Athletics when flipping across obstacles.

stunts.name: Psychic Scalpel
stunts.description: Because of my precise medical training and constant exposure to the supernatural, I get a +2 to Will when I make mental attacks against ghosts or other spiritual entities.

output.notes: This stunt provides a direct offensive use for your highest skill, Will, that perfectly matches your character's concept as a medic who deals with spirits. The name 'Psychic Scalpel' reinforces the blend of medical and supernatural themes.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Plucky Archaeologist Seeking Forbidden Truths

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: A Magnet for Mythological Misfortune

stunts.name: Silver Tongue
stunts.description: +2 to Create Advantage with Rapport when sowing doubt.

stunts.name: Foretold in the Hieroglyphs
stunts.description: Once per scene, you can use your Lore skill to Defend against a supernatural threat or an ancient trap.

output.notes: Suggesting a new stunt for the character. This stunt provides a defensive option tied to their archaeological knowledge, fitting the concept of dealing with mythological dangers. It is limited to once per scene as requested.

meta.idea: Retired monster hunter pulled back in

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Reluctant Slayer of Nightmares

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Monsters Haven't Forgotten Me

stunts.name: Monstrous Logic
stunts.description: You've spent a lifetime hunting things that don't follow human rules. You gain a +2 bonus when you use Investigate to Overcome an obstacle that is a trap, puzzle, or non-physical barrier created by a supernatural entity.

output.notes: This stunt provides an edge-case utility, as requested. It leverages your highest skill, Investigate, for the Overcome action in a very specific, flavourful context: dealing with the unnatural traps and puzzles monsters leave behind. It reinforces the idea of a seasoned hunter who has seen it all and can recognize the patterns in a creature's thinking.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Fugitive Alchemist on a Desperate Quest

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Magnum Opus Is My Curse

stunts.name: Alchemical Analysis
stunts.description: Because of your deep understanding of chemical and mystical properties, you can use Lore instead of Investigate to Overcome obstacles when analyzing strange substances, magical traps, or complex ailments.

output.notes: Here's a stunt suggestion that leans into your character's alchemical background and their quest for a cure. It provides a powerful mechanical benefit for overcoming challenges related to research and analysis, which seems central to their story.

meta.idea: Clockwork tinkerer with a human heart

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Clockwork Automaton with a Human Heart

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Emotions Overload My Circuits

stunts.name: Clockwork Cascade
stunts.description: Once per scene, when you use Crafts to create an advantage by jury-rigging a complex contraption from nearby parts, you can declare you're setting up a cascade. If you succeed, the situation aspect you create is particularly complex and difficult to undo, imposing a +2 opposition against any Overcome rolls to remove it.

output.notes: Here is a cinematic stunt for Crafts. It allows you to create a complex, hard-to-remove advantage on the fly by building an intricate device, fitting the clockwork tinkerer concept perfectly.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: A Mountain of a Man with a Heart of a Dove

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Scars of My Violent Past

stunts.name: Acrobat's Flourish
stunts.description: +2 to Overcome with Athletics when flipping across obstacles.

stunts.name: A Bear's Embrace
stunts.description: Because I am a **Mountain of a Man** sworn to nonviolence, I gain a +2 when I use Physique to make an attack intended to non-lethally restrain or grapple an opponent.

output.notes: This stunt provides a way to use Physique for an 'attack' action that aligns perfectly with your character's non-violent creed. It focuses on subduing and restraining opponents rather than causing harm, turning your immense strength into a tool for de-escalation.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Gentleman Thief with an Unbreakable Code

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: Can't Turn Down a Worthy Challenge

stunts.name: Silver Tongue
stunts.description: +2 to Create Advantage with Rapport when sowing doubt.

stunts.name: Unshakeable Composure
stunts.description: Once per scene, gain +2 to your Will roll when defending against a Provoke attack.

output.notes: A gentleman thief must remain cool under pressure. This stunt provides a strong social defense option, reflecting your character's calm and collected nature when someone tries to intimidate or emotionally manipulate them. It's a great complement to the more proactive 'Silver Tongue' stunt.

meta.idea: Haunted bard who remembers future songs

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Prescient Minstrel Haunted by Unsung Melodies

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: These Aren't My Songs

stunts.name: Hymn of the Oncoming Storm
stunts.description: The future songs are a cacophony of fear, sorrow, and dread, but you've learned to use that. Once per session, when you must make an Overcome roll to resist mental or emotional influence, you may use Rapport instead of Will. You are not calming yourself, but rather overwhelming the external influence with a glimpse of all the sorrows yet to come.

output.notes: This stunt provides a thematic, edge-case use for your peak skill (Rapport) to overcome a key character weakness (low Will). It directly engages with the 'Haunted' part of your High Concept, turning a vulnerability into a situational strength.

meta.idea: Daring skyship pilot chasing living storms
meta.setting: Shattered archipelago where cities float above an endless storm belt; guilds hoard wind-lore.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Storm-Chasing Skyship Ace

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Wind-Wardens Want Me Grounded

stunts.name: Eye of the Storm
stunts.description: Because I've flown through the heart of a living gale, I get a +2 to Overcome obstacles with Drive when piloting my skyship through hazardous weather.

output.notes: Here's a stunt focused on the core concept of piloting through dangerous storms, specifically helping with the Overcome action as requested.

meta.setting: A city built inside a petrified god; memories become spirits that must be archived or set free.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Memory-Binding Witch Archivist

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: Echoes of Other Lives Haunt Me

stunts.name: Inscription of a Lingering Echo
stunts.description: When you succeed with style using Lore to create an advantage by pulling a memory from a person or place, you can choose to create a lingering spectral echo. This aspect is placed on the scene with one free invoke and requires an Overcome action against Fair (+2) difficulty to remove, instead of you getting a second free invoke.

output.notes: This stunt gives your Lore skill a unique, cinematic flair when you're creating advantages. It allows you to make your discoveries more tangible and impactful on the scene, turning a fleeting memory into a persistent obstacle or tool for your allies.

meta.setting: Broken kingdoms after a demon winter; fiendish contracts persist like legal curses.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Pact-Cursed Warlock on the Run

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Fiend's Mark Still Burns

stunts.name: Acrobat's Flourish
stunts.description: +2 to Overcome with Athletics when flipping across obstacles.

stunts.name: Soulfire Lash
stunts.description: Because I know the pain of a corrupted soul, I can turn that knowledge into a weapon. Gain a +2 to Will when attacking a target that is demonic, infernal, or otherwise supernaturally bound.

output.notes: This stunt gives you a powerful combat option using your highest skill, Will. It's thematically tied to your character's backstory as a warlock, making you particularly effective against the very forces you're trying to escape.

meta.setting: Forests rearrange every dawn; cartographers are folk heroes and oracles argue with maps.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Time-Lost Surveyor of the Shifting Wilds

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Maps Lead to Places That No Longer Exist

stunts.name: Silver Tongue
stunts.description: +2 to Create Advantage with Rapport when sowing doubt.

stunts.name: The Land Defends Me
stunts.description: Once per scene, when defending in the wilds, you can gain a +3 bonus by predicting a sudden environmental shift (a root snags your opponent, a branch falls in their way) that hinders an attack.

output.notes: A defensive stunt that leans into the character's unique connection with the shifting wilds. It's a powerful, reactive ability that makes them feel at home and in control of their chaotic environment.

meta.setting: Crystalline lunar shards crashed into the sea; refugees barter starlight technology for sanctuary.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Exiled Emissary of the Shattered Moon

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My People's Survival Rests On My Shoulders

stunts.name: Whispering Starlight Shard
stunts.description: Once per session, when faced with an obstacle involving ancient or forgotten technology, you can use Rapport instead of Lore to overcome it. You coax the necessary information from the living memory of your personal starlight shard.

output.notes: This stunt provides a unique, edge-case utility by allowing you to use your high Rapport skill in place of a likely-low Lore skill. It directly incorporates the 'starlight technology' theme from your character's background, giving you a distinct advantage in specific situations.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Fugitive Alchemist on a Desperate Quest

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Magnum Opus Is My Curse

aspects.name: The Alchemists' Guild Wants Its Secrets Back
aspects.description: I created my Magnum Opus using forbidden knowledge, and now the Guild will stop at nothing to reclaim it—or silence me permanently.

output.notes: This aspect introduces a specific antagonist, giving a reason for being a fugitive and adding immediate stakes. It's double-edged: you can invoke it when using your unique alchemical knowledge, but it can be compelled to bring in Guild assassins or other complications at the worst possible moments.

meta.idea: Clockwork tinkerer with a human heart

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Clockwork Automaton with a Human Heart

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Emotions Overload My Circuits

aspects.name: Old Debt
aspects.description: Owes favors to a shadowy syndicate.

aspects.name: My Heart is a Priceless Artifact
aspects.description: My power source and emotional core is a unique and coveted object that others would kill to possess.

output.notes: This aspect makes the 'human heart' a literal, tangible element that drives the story. It can be invoked for feats of endurance or when your unique nature gives you insight. It's also a powerful source for compels, as collectors, scientists, or the syndicate you owe might try to steal or control the artifact at the core of your being.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: A Mountain of a Man with a Heart of a Dove

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Scars of My Violent Past

aspects.name: Mentor's Lesson
aspects.description: Never strike first—set the stage.

aspects.name: Lucky Charm
aspects.description: Superstition that sometimes works.

input.user_note: Keep them grounded in the setting.

aspects.name: Strength is for Building, Not Breaking
aspects.description: This personal creed allows him to excel at constructive uses of his power, but presents a difficult choice when destruction seems like the only answer.

output.notes: This aspect provides a clear philosophy for the character that ties directly into his high Physique skill. It creates interesting scenarios for both invokes (using his strength for constructive, non-violent purposes) and compels (when faced with a situation where breaking things seems like the only option).

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Gentleman Thief with an Unbreakable Code

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: Can't Turn Down a Worthy Challenge

aspects.name: A Reputation That Precedes Me
aspects.description: Whether as a charming socialite or a phantom thief, people have heard of me. This can open doors, but it also means I'm the first one they suspect when something goes missing.

output.notes: This aspect plays into the 'Gentleman Thief' concept. It's double-edged: your fame can grant you access and intimidate rivals, but it also brings unwanted attention from the law and competitors, tying into your Trouble.

meta.idea: Haunted bard who remembers future songs

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Prescient Minstrel Haunted by Unsung Melodies

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: These Aren't My Songs

aspects.name: Reputation Precedes
aspects.description: Doors open—sometimes to traps.

aspects.name: The Right Tune at the Right Time
aspects.description: Sometimes the 'right' tune is a dirge at a wedding.

output.notes: This aspect connects your prescience directly to your role as a bard, suggesting you instinctively know the perfect song for any moment—for better or for worse. It's a great way to justify using your high Rapport or Empathy in unusual situations, and the description provides a clear hook for compels.

meta.idea: Daring skyship pilot chasing living storms
meta.setting: Shattered archipelago where cities float above an endless storm belt; guilds hoard wind-lore.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Storm-Chasing Skyship Ace

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Wind-Wardens Want Me Grounded

aspects.name: My Ship is a Thing of Beauty and Patches
aspects.description: The 'Tempest Treader' is a custom marvel, faster and more agile than any guild-built vessel, but its bleeding-edge components are prone to failing under pressure.

output.notes: This aspect gives you a strong connection to your skyship, your primary tool. It's double-edged: you can invoke its superior capabilities when you need a burst of speed or a tight turn, but it can be compelled against you when a crucial, jury-rigged system breaks down in the middle of a storm or a chase.

meta.setting: A city built inside a petrified god; memories become spirits that must be archived or set free.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Memory-Binding Witch Archivist

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: Echoes of Other Lives Haunt Me

aspects.name: Old Debt
aspects.description: Owes favors to a shadowy syndicate.

aspects.name: Keeper of the Silent Archive
aspects.description: My hidden library of memory-spirits is both a sanctuary and a great vulnerability.

output.notes: This aspect provides a concrete place of power and responsibility that is deeply tied to your character's concept. It offers clear opportunities for invokes (accessing forgotten knowledge from the archive) and compels (an entity attacks the archive, a dangerous memory escapes, or its upkeep requires a difficult sacrifice).

meta.setting: Broken kingdoms after a demon winter; fiendish contracts persist like legal curses.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Pact-Cursed Warlock on the Run

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Fiend's Mark Still Burns

aspects.name: Mentor's Lesson
aspects.description: Never strike first—set the stage.

aspects.name: Lucky Charm
aspects.description: Superstition that sometimes works.

input.user_note: Keep them grounded in the setting.

aspects.name: Bound by Fine Print and Blood
aspects.description: My pact is a labyrinth of legalese, a source of loopholes and hidden traps.

output.notes: This aspect connects your character's core conflict with the setting's idea of 'legal curses'. It creates a clear reason to use your high Lore skill to find loopholes, and offers the GM a way to compel you with forgotten clauses in the demonic contract.

meta.setting: Forests rearrange every dawn; cartographers are folk heroes and oracles argue with maps.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Time-Lost Surveyor of the Shifting Wilds

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Maps Lead to Places That No Longer Exist

aspects.name: The Forest Remembers What I've Forgotten
aspects.description: I have a deep, almost supernatural connection to the shifting wilds. It can grant me flashes of insight into its nature or my own lost past, but its 'memories' can also be fragmented, dangerous, or misleading.

output.notes: This aspect creates a mystical link between your character and the strange environment. It provides a narrative reason for insights (invokes for Investigate or Notice checks) and a source of danger when the forest's 'memories' are hostile or confusing (compels).

meta.setting: Crystalline lunar shards crashed into the sea; refugees barter starlight technology for sanctuary.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Exiled Emissary of the Shattered Moon

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My People's Survival Rests On My Shoulders

aspects.name: Reputation Precedes
aspects.description: Doors open—sometimes to traps.

aspects.name: Bearer of the Last Lunar Shard
aspects.description: This fragment of my home is our last hope and my greatest burden.

output.notes: This aspect introduces a tangible, powerful element from your character's backstory. It can be invoked when using lunar technology, bartering for your people's future, or when its power is needed. It can also be compelled by making it a target for thieves or a source of dangerous, unstable energy.

meta.setting: Neon monastery in a megacity; scriptures live in glitching data-ghosts.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Data-Ghost Scribe of the Neon Monastery

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Glitch Hears Me Back

aspects.name: Wired to the Void
aspects.description: This deep connection to the data stream allows you to parse information that would drive others mad. However, the Void is not a passive source, and its corrupting influence can be compelled to isolate you or twist your perceptions of reality.

output.notes: Suggesting an aspect that reflects the character's intimate, and dangerous, relationship with the digital prophecies. It offers a clear benefit for their investigation and a potent source of complications.

meta.setting: Vertical jungle reserve threaded through arcology levels; fauna evolved alongside drones.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Guardian Beast-Speaker of the Arcology Jungle

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: The Beasts' Rage Is My Own

aspects.name: Old Debt
aspects.description: Owes favors to a shadowy syndicate.

aspects.name: My Flock of 'Scout-Hawk' Drones
aspects.description: My custom drones are my eyes and ears in the vertical jungle, but they can be hacked or draw the wrong kind of attention.

output.notes: This aspect ties your character directly into the unique setting, blending the 'beast-speaker' idea with the high-tech environment. It provides clear opportunities for creating advantages (scouting, distraction) and for compels (drones get damaged, hacked, or draw unwanted attention).

meta.setting: Steam-and-sigil railways where packages are oath-bound; couriers duel with contracts.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Oath-Bound Runesmith Courier

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: My Last Delivery Went Boom

aspects.name: Mentor's Lesson
aspects.description: Never strike first—set the stage.

aspects.name: Lucky Charm
aspects.description: Superstition that sometimes works.

input.user_note: Keep them grounded in the setting.

aspects.name: The Cogwork Cartel Wants Their 'Package' Back
aspects.description: My last delivery didn't just explode; it was stolen from under my nose. Now a powerful shipping syndicate is hunting me for what they lost, and they don't care about collateral damage.

output.notes: This aspect provides a specific antagonist connected to your Trouble, 'My Last Delivery Went Boom.' It grounds your character in the world by creating a clear threat and a source of ongoing conflict, perfect for both invokes (when using your knowledge of their operations) and compels (when they show up to complicate your life).

meta.setting: Harbor city where ghost tides roll in nightly; offerings are tickets to the afterlife ferries.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Ferryman's Chef for the Restless Dead

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: I Feel Their Unfinished Business

aspects.name: Phase Aspect
aspects.description: Never Turn Away a Hungry Soul

output.notes: This aspect provides a strong, driving principle for your character. It's a personal code that can be invoked when your compassion helps you connect with and aid a spirit, but it's also a powerful hook for compels, forcing you to help a dangerous, difficult, or inconvenient soul who comes seeking a meal.

meta.setting: Industrial league debates personhood of constructs; artisan unions sponsor sentience trials.

aspects.name: High Concept
aspects.description: Heartfelt Orator for the Heartless

aspects.name: Trouble
aspects.description: A Slave to Newly Awakened Emotions

aspects.name: Reputation Precedes
aspects.description: Doors open—sometimes to traps.

aspects.name: A Soul Forged, Not Born
aspects.description: My core belief and a rallying cry for my cause.

output.notes: This aspect provides a clear, powerful ideological statement for your character. It's a 'punchy' summary of their entire motivation, perfect for invoking during passionate speeches (Rapport) or when researching the nature of constructs (Lore). It can also be compelled when confronted with undeniable proof of a construct's 'soulless' nature, challenging your deeply held beliefs.
